intro: Anguria rufipila, commonly known as the red-stemmed nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature and are edible, though they contain toxic compounds. Anguria rufipila is often found in moist, shaded areas in tropical and subtropical regions.
